hanzi-su-wiki:
擦

Значения

Тереть, чиркать (спичкой); тереться, снашиваться, становиться потёртым

Мнемоника

Осторожно обследовать, растирая руками 扌 больное место, пытаясь поставить 察 точный диагноз.

Варианты

抆
purpleculture_pinyin:
cā
to wipe; to erase; rubbing (brush stroke in painting); to clean; to polish
протирать; стереть; втирание (мазок кисти в живописи); чистить; полировать
rtega_mnemonic:
擦擦RSwipe, scrub, rub, scour, brush
  • hand 扌 wiping off dust from an object to be investigated 察
purpleculture_info: Pictophonetic: 察 indicates the sound; 扌 (hand) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
摩擦 [ mó cā ]: friction; rubbing; chafing; fig. disharmony; conflict; also written 磨擦
擦拭 [ cā shì ]: to wipe clean
擦肩而过 [ cā jiān ér guò ]: brief encounter; to brush past sb
擦洗 [ cā xǐ ]: to clean (with water or alcohol); to wipe and wash; to swab; to scrub
摩拳擦掌 [ mó quán cā zhǎng ]: fig. to rub one's fists and wipe one's palms (idiom); to roll up one's sleeves for battle; eager to get into action or start on a task
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 扌 [ shǒu ] hand
    • 察 [ chá ] to examine, to investigate, to observe
heisig_chinese_memo: Your fingers scrutinize the situation by feeling for hardened particles on the dishes while scrubbing them. &nbsp
heisig_constituent: grate, finger, fingers, guess, house, ritual, moon, month, flesh, part of the body, crotch, altar, show, two, small
Keyword_KANJIDIC: grate, rub, scratch, scrape, chafe, scour
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: колосник, протирка, царапина, царапина, Chafe, размыв
koohiiStory1: If you mis-guess the cheese you´ll grate your fingers on the cheese-grater (happens to me all the time).
koohiiStory2: Ouch! Guess how many fingers I just grated in the grater? (Edit: OR: Ouch! Guess what I just grated in the grater? -- my finger!).
kunYomi: す.る、す.れる、-ず.れ、こす.る、こす.れる
jp_example_words:
擦る(かする): to touch lightly, to take a percentage (from)
擦れ違い(すれちがい): chance encounter
擦れる(すれる): to rub, to chafe, to wear, to become sophisticated
擦る(こする): rub, scrub
摩擦(まさつ): friction, rubbing, rubdown, chafe
jp_readingExamples: 擦る (す.る), 擦れる (す.れる)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You hold the roof of the festival up with your fingers but it grates on them. The roof is heavy, and you have to walk to keep up, so the roof is grating on them really, really badly.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Have you ever been to a Japanese festival? There's always one of those portable shrines that are basically just roofs people hold up. That's what you're trying to hold with your fingers as the whole thing grates on them.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Just when you thought the grating couldn't get worse, someone sat (さつ) down on the roof! AHG! It hurts!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture a very large person that decided to sat down right on top of the roof you've been carrying through the festival. The weight makes the grating so much worse, you can feel the skin coming off of your fingers.
Ru_Meaning: grate, rub, scratch, scrape, chafe, scour
Ru_Notes: Не путать: 捺 (さす、おす、ナツ、ダツ прикладывать печать).
Ru_Words:
擦るする
  • (See 摩る) тереть
  • делать матовым
    • warodai
    擦るこする
  • тереть, растирать, обтирать, утирать, стирать
    • warodai
    擦るなする
  • намазывать что-л., натирать чем-л., втирать
  • (See なすりつける) перен.
    • warodai
    擦れるすれる
  • тереться
  • (See すれた) стираться, снашиваться, становиться потёртым, перен. портиться, грубеть (о ком-л.)
    • warodai
    擦り込むすりこむ
  • втирать, растирать вместе (что-л. с чем-л.)
    • warodai
    擦れ合うすれあう
  • тереться друг о друга
  • перен. иметь трения с кем-л., расходиться во мнениях
    • warodai
    塗擦とさつ
  • втирание (мази и т. п.)
    • warodai
    擦傷さっしょう
  • кн. ссадина, царапина
    • warodai
    摩擦まさつ
  • трение, истирание
Ru_Radicals: ノ, 二 (два), 宀 (значок У), 小 (маленький), 扎, 癶 (крыша с точками), 示 (указывать)
Ru_trainchinese:
cā: (глаг) мыть, тереть; натирать (на терке)
cā: (глаг) легко прикасаться, едва задевать; применять, наносить
Kanshudo_mnemonic: you surmise (察) that the hand (扌) is getting chafed
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Your fingers scrutinize the situation by feeling for hardened particles on the dishes while scrubbing them. &nbsp Then you go with a steel brush instead of a sponge to save time and money. &nbsp
humanum_full_description_en:
From " hand " to " chat " sound, the original meaning is friction. "Zhengzitong‧ Hand": "Wipe, it is urgent to rub it." Song Su Shi, "Objective Feelings·Clothes": "Greasy clothes, ironed with charcoal fire, or rubbed with talc." Ming Tang Xianzu "Peony" Pavilion‧ Picking up Paintings": "The green moss is slippery, leaning against the low piles of broken walls.

" Rubbing " also means being close. Song Xu Mengxin's "Three Dynasties Beimenghui" Volume 66: "Let the temple wipe the city, the winners will reward money."

" Wipe " is also often used for wiping and wiping. "The Scholars" Chapter 42: "The girls took out their sweat towels to wipe them, and he took them away to wipe their limbs." "A Dream of Red Mansions" Chapter 44: "Sister should also put some powder on, otherwise, it looks like It's like she's angry with Sister Feng."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " hand " and " chat ", the original meaning is friction.
humanum_full_description:
從「手」，「察」聲，本義為摩擦。《正字通‧手部》：「擦，摩之急也。」宋蘇軾《物類相感志‧衣服》：「油污衣，用炭火熨之，或以滑石擦熨之。」明湯顯祖《牡丹亭‧拾畫》：「蒼苔滑擦，倚逗著斷垣低垛。」

　　「擦」也表示貼近。宋徐夢莘《三朝北盟會編》卷66：「令殿班擦城下，戰勝者賞金帛。」

　　「擦」還常用作擦拭和擦抹。《儒林外史》第42回：「姑娘們拿出汗巾子來揩，他又奪去擦夾肢窩。」《紅樓夢》第44回：「姐姐還該擦上些脂粉，不然，倒像是和鳳姐姐賭氣似的。」

擦字的基本解释

擦
cā
揩拭：擦脸。擦洗。擦桌子。
搽，涂敷：擦粉。擦油。
摩，搓：摩拳擦掌。擦澡。
贴近：擦黑（傍晚）。擦边。
揩抹拭涂

擦字的汉语字典释义

[①]［cā］
［《字彙》初戛切］
(1)物与物相摩擦；轻轻碰撞。
(2)指把玩。
(3)顶撞。
(4)贴近；挨。
(5)揩拭。
(6)搽抹。
(7)抹去。指田粮等的减免。
(8)刨擦瓜果，使成为细丝状。
(9)怯。参见“擦生生”、“擦擦”。

擦字的英文翻译

◎ 擦
rub, brush, scrape, wipe

擦字的康熙字典解释

【卯集中】【手字部】　擦； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页460第09
【篇海】【字彙】?初戛切，音察。摩之急也。

擦字的源字形

擦字的起名意思

本意指摩擦，也有揩拭，除去，靠近的意思。

rub
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［cā］
[The first cut of "Words"]
(1) Objects rub against objects; collisions lightly.
(2) Refers to playing.
(3) Confrontation.
(4) Close to;
(5) Wipe.
(6) Wipe.
(7) Erase. Refers to the reduction or exemption of crops, etc.
(8) Plan and rub the fruits to make them into filaments.
(9) Cowardly. See "wiping Shengsheng", "wiping".

тереть
~
Тереть
«Кай)
cā
гл.
1) тереть, вытирать, чистить; драить
擦了脸 вытереть лицо
擦玻璃 тереть (протирать) стёкла
擦皮鞋 чистить ботинки
擦汗 вытирать пот
擦字 стереть написанное
2) тереть, натирать, растирать; шинковать
把西葫芦擦成丝儿 тереть (шинковать) кабачки на тёрке
3) чиркать
再擦, 也擦不着 чиркаю, чиркаю ― никак не загорается
一擦就着 раз чиркнуть ― и вспыхнет (о спичках: перен. о вспыльчивом, экспансивном человеке)
4) задевать; едва не задеть (при движении)
擦着地 едва не задевать за землю (о самолёте), идти на бреющем полёте
Radicals: 扌, 宀, 祭  (fingers, roof, festival)
Meaning Mnemonic
You hold the roof of the festival up with your fingers but it grates on them. The roof is heavy, and you have to walk to keep up, so the roof is grating on them really, really badly.
Have you ever been to a Japanese festival? There's always one of those portable shrines that are basically just roofs people hold up. That's what you're trying to hold with your fingers as the whole thing grates on them.
Reading Mnemonic
Just when you thought the grating couldn't get worse, someone sat (さつ) down on the roof! AHG! It hurts!
Picture a very large person that decided to sat down right on top of the roof you've been carrying through the festival. The weight makes the grating so much worse, you can feel the skin coming off of your fingers.
